verses.verse: Sing aloud<WH7442> unto God<WH430> our strength<WH5797>: make a joyful noise<WH7321> unto the God<WH430> of Jacob<WH3290>.
Take<WH5375> a psalm<WH2172>, and bring<WH5414> here the tambourine<WH8596>, the pleasant<WH5273> harp<WH3658> with the psaltery<WH5035>.
Blow up<WH8628> the trumpet<WH7782> in the new moon<WH2320>, in the time appointed<WH3677>, on our solemn feast<WH2282> day<WH3117>.
For this was a statute<WH2706> for Israel<WH3478>, and a law<WH4941> of the God<WH430> of Jacob<WH3290>.

This he ordained<WH7760> in Joseph<WH3084> for a testimony<WH5715>, when he went out<WH3318> through the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>: where I heard<WH8085> a language<WH8193> that I understood not<WH3045>.
I removed<WH5493> his shoulder<WH7926> from the burden<WH5447>: his hands<WH3709> were delivered<WH5674> from the pots<WH1731>.

You called<WH7121> in trouble<WH6869>, and I delivered<WH2502> you<WH6030>; I answered you in the secret place<WH5643> of thunder<WH7482>: I proved<WH974> you at the waters<WH4325> of Meribah<WH4809>. Selah<WH5542>.
Hear<WH8085>, O my people<WH5971>, and I will testify<WH5749> unto you<WH3478>: O Israel, if you will listen unto me<WH8085>;
There shall no strange<WH2114> god<WH410> be in you<WH7812>; neither shall you worship any strange<WH5236> god<WH410>.
I am the Lord<WH3068> your God<WH430>, which brought<WH5927> you out of the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>: open your mouth<WH6310> wide<WH7337>, and I will fill it<WH4390>.
But my people<WH5971> would not listen<WH8085> to my voice<WH6963>; and Israel<WH3478> would have nothing to do with me<WH14>.
So I gave them up<WH7971> unto their own hearts<WH3820>' lust<WH8307>: and they walked<WH3212> in their own counsels<WH4156>.
Oh<WH3863> that my people<WH5971> had listened<WH8085> unto me<WH3478>, and Israel had walked<WH1980> in my ways<WH1870>!
I should soon<WH4592> have subdued<WH3665> their enemies<WH341>, and turned<WH7725> my hand<WH3027> against their adversaries<WH6862>.
The haters<WH8130> of the Lord<WH3068> should have submitted<WH3584> themselves unto him<WH6256>: but their time should have endured for ever<WH5769>.
He should have fed<WH398> them also with the finest<WH2459> of the wheat<WH2406>: and with honey<WH1706> out of the rock<WH6697> should I have satisfied you<WH7646>.
